> [{quoted}](name=FACE THE WlND,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=f1uAYKWE,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-04-21T13:09:48.952+0000)
>
> Zed's not a mage.

you missed the point. Riot gave Mages those restrictions but not AD champions, especially Zed and Yasuo.

Maybe it's just me but I don't think the two can be compared. Zed's wave clear is gated by cooldowns and energy, and to clear a whole wave early he needs to use his escape. Mages have more utility, generally lower cooldowns, and late game mana is way better than energy. Yasuo's wave clear is short range other than his third Q, and is based off of his auto attacks, and he doesn't have the security mages do.

The 6 second CD on his Q is lower than almost every mage while having equal or longer range and higher base damage. Syndra's Q is 4 seconds for 50 damage. Zed's Q starts at 75 and triple-scales off his AD, W, and R.
Different types of champs idk why syndra is being compared to zed.

> Zed's wave clear is gated by cooldowns and energy

Because of fuckery like this.

"Gated by cooldowns?" He cannot literally spam Q, he can just use it more often that most mages because the cooldown is *shorter* than most mages' skills. While doing more damage. That's hardly "gating."

He's not gated by energy. He gets energy refunded, it naturally regens fast, and he can regen faster in other ways. His energy will always be high enough to use Q on cooldown if that's the only skill he's using. If he uses more, he gets refunds. That is not gating.

Syndra is basically one of the only champs with a shorter CD poke than Zed, so I used her as an example. It's basically just Syndra and Ori, and both of their Qs are just infinitely weaker than Zed. It's worth mentioning that the mages with longer CD Qs are also weaker with the lone exception of Ahri.

> and to clear a whole wave early he needs to use his escape

And to clear a whole wave early, mages just have to oom themselves and forfeit lane to the Zed. And he really doesn't even need to use W. Just spam that Q honey, it'll do the work for you.

For one mana is better than energy late game. Zed Q is physical damage, and the damage falls off after hitting one enemy. Syndra's Q is aoe, deals full dame to all enemies hit, lower cooldown, and scales better late game due to the fact that it deals magic damage.

mana and energy champions are fundamentally different, with mages having a much larger pool to spam more in a short period of time, but much less regen so they can't do it for as long.

so many people are complaining about the qss nerf too, but i'm honestly happy for it because it means zed can actually be balanced around always having his ult.  that entire thing was part of the reason zed was allowed to be so dominant.  

i personally kind of wish that everyone used energy instead of just a few, but with slightly larger pools and slower regen, so that way everybody could spam abilities.  more abilities = more fun, as shown by urf mode

> [{quoted}](name=FACE THE WlND,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=f1uAYKWE,comment-id=00030000000000000000000000000000000000020000,timestamp=2016-04-21T18:37:18.649+0000)

I think at the end of the day, the fundamental problem, even if you take away all the numbers, is that assassin are suppose to have two key flaws: one, to be weak and susceptible especially in the early game, and two, that in order to shut them down in midlane, either shove them into the turret or punish their turret heavily if they roam. Its their trademark for how you deal with them.

You really can not look at anyone and say with a straight face that Zed is weak in the early game, nor say that shoving him into the turret actually works. 

When you look at how he is not weak early game, coupled with the fact he isn't gated by nearly anything outside of shadow cool-downs, coupled with his ridiculous wave clear, its a recipe for a champion who is going to be infuriating. 

The argument he falls off late game really doesn't work, I get that people say he falls off late game because his teamfight is terrible.

Which FYI, I do agree with, keep a Braum on backline carry, when Zed ults in a teamfight, he's gone, his team-fighting is objectively terrible. But team fighting isn't the only part of the game in late game. Split-pushing and making picks are also important at which he excels greatly at.

It's no use. I could point out that by rushing an item to completely void a member of their team makes that item 100000% more cost efficient, or that his poke is skillshots and are fairly easy to dodge (imo), or that unless you take a lot of harrass or just don't have hp pots then you can't be all-inned by him (just like any mid assassin) but they will just downvote and downvote because you aren't allowed to point out reasonable things if it's from the wrong side of the argument. 

The boards will never recognize exceptions, it's always black and white for them. Zed op? everything about him needs to be nerfed (q dmg, w cd, e slow, r avoiding) I've seen them all. Point out that there are ways to counter him until he gets a reasonable nerf? Nah, downvote!

For example: Look at Spaceman5PFF's comment right below mine. He disagrees from personal experience from the PBE showing that mana isn't much of an issue with catalyst, but the boards only look at the on-paper stats and assume they know how it'll interact with the game. Ignore the fact that he has personal experience, he's just downvoted because he disagrees with a point made in the op and presented actual experience and every argument against him so far has been "you're wrong because the stats couldn't do that" despite just making assumptions on the stat's interactions with the game.

Now don't get me wrong boards, I agree Zed should be nerfed. His build paths are too fluid, his safety is too strong for an assassin, etc etc. But you can't post a thread and just downvote anyone that has a different opinion simply because you don't like it. Don't be so close-minded to not listen to reason, not everything has to be 100 or 0. Zed is op, that's for sure, but there *are* weaknesses to him and tips to beat him. 

And with that, I shall leave this thread to allow all the Zed haters to line up in agreement that Zed is broken af and needs to be deleted from the game. I've accumulated enough downvotes for not picking a side

That means Zed's farming MIGHT get him refunded 40 energy out of the 140 he spent to blow his entire kit at level 7 (if Zed literally puts his shadow under him to hit double E's). If you cannot punish that man in the 6 seconds he is basically useless then that is ALL on you.

For anyone who doesn't know.. 

How to beat Zed when he's not already stomping 

 Push your wave so he is pressured into using his spells and wait for his energy bar to be below 33%.

Engage.

> Push your wave so he is pressured into using his spells and wait for his energy bar to be below 33%.

He's never really pressured. He can easily CS under tower because his passive helps him execute minions. If he is about to miss a CS, then and only then does he need to waste a Q on the minion wave. 
And how is a mage supposed to push the wave early on without going OOM? That's only going to get worse with the itemization changes, which seem intentionally designed to prevent mages from using mana to push and waveclear.
Also, if you as a mage are pushing the lane, you are inviting a jungle gank and a Zed W+R on top of you.

> Lol if Zed uses his spells to clear a wave go fucking kill his ass.

Zed CAN use his spells to waveclear (he can also easily last-hit minions to freeze the lane, throwing out Qs to harass or poke), but how can you go "kill his ass" when he has a W to disengage? He's very difficult to all-in unless your jungler is there with some CC.

I don't even understand why Riot want mage to worry about mana when they are The Magic users. They should build for infinite power aka never worry about mana and not even care about blue buff late game.

And in front of them they have manaless champs, energy users and ADC with {{item:3508}}.

I love how all the Zed mains are super defensive over this, trying to scrape for any and every excuse that helps them attempt to hide that Zed is going to be a freaking broken unbeatable god in the new patch.
With the new update mid year, mages no longer have to worry about this decision.
Wat? It's 10x worse.

I mean, I might have a unique experience but from my testing of the changes, I've never needed to worry about mana as long as I built the right items. Lost chapter makes it really easy to sustain in lane, and tear makes poking a breeze. If you get an early water drake? You will never need to make decisions about mana again.

I'm sure you can build to never worry about mana. I mean, tear will solve pretty much all your mana problems on most champions... but this update is hugely removing diversity. RoA is more of a tank item now (it only gives 400 mana anyways) and I can't see myself building it on most mid laners. Morellos is probably the "de facto" mana item now and it mixes elements of the old AuG and current morellos.. it's not terrible but by itself won't solve most champions mana issues. So you can opt for a big power spike or a much more permanent solution. Compare that to live where we have four viable options for resource generation.. RoA, Archangels, AuG and Morellos, you can go whichever of these suits your champion best or even more than one! I fail to see how limiting build diversity is good for the game.
